summary: This is an email from a prosecutor in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, informing a colleague that Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team intends to seek approval to issue a 'friendly subpoena' to the lawyer for a minor victim (Victim-4). The goal is to obtain non-privileged materials related to the victim's 2008 settlement with Jeffrey Epstein, for trial preparation and potential impeachment material.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as 'Maxwell' and the subject of the defense team's actions; her team is seeking to subpoena materials related to a victim's settlement with Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the party with whom 'Minor Victim-4' reached a settlement in approximately 2008.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: Identified as the latest victim whose abuse gives rise to a superseding indictment; her 2008 settlement with Epstein is the subject of the requested subpoena.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant in a case related to Epstein's abuse, and her defense is seeking materials from a victim's settlement with Epstein.
The document references the victim's abuse by Epstein and a subsequent settlement with him in 2008.
Maxwell's defense team is seeking to subpoena materials related to Victim-4's settlement with Epstein for trial preparation and potential impeachment.

events.title: Settlement between Epstein and Victim-4
events.description: Minor Victim-4 reached a settlement with Jeffrey Epstein regarding her abuse.

events.title: Request for Friendly Subpoena
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team seeks approval to issue a subpoena to the lawyer for Minor Victim-4 for non-privileged materials related to her 2008 settlement with Epstein.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team planned to subpoena materials related to a victim's 2008 settlement with Jeffrey Epstein.
The victim is identified as 'Minor Victim-4,' whose abuse is the basis for a superseding indictment.
The defense sought the materials for trial preparation and as potential impeachment (Giglio) material against the witness.
The victim's lawyer was willing to provide the materials but believed a subpoena was necessary.
The communication reveals strategic legal maneuvering by the defense to obtain settlement details in a high-profile case.
